description.content: This API supports complete disbursement of fund to an individual of company recipient. Payment Initialization & Disbursement - Merchants provides the payment, recipient and Card information for payment initialization & disbursement.

header.description: (Required) An API key is a string value passed by a client app to the API proxies. The key uniquely identifies the client app.
(Required) Epoch timestamp in the request initiating system
Token provided by DDP along with public key /tokens API. This is required for encrypted PCI data vaulting. This is to identify public key associated with access token to decrypt the PCI data.

(Required) Contains a unique ID generated by the client that can be used for enforcing idempotency on POST actions. POSTs are inherently non-idempotent and submitting the exact same request multiple times would create duplicate resources. Note:- Omitting this header increases the risk of duplicate transactions, which for payments could cost the client issues like double-billing.

response.name: Initialization response - Success

header.description: (Required) An API key is a string value passed by a client app to the API proxies. The key uniquely identifies the client app.
(Required) Epoch timestamp in the request initiating system
(Required) Authorization information for the request. Format- `HMAC {hmacToken}`
Token provided by DDP along with public key /tokens API. This is required for encrypted PCI data vaulting. This is to identify public key associated with access token to decrypt the PCI data.

(Required) Contains a unique ID generated by the client that can be used for enforcing idempotency on POST actions. POSTs are inherently non-idempotent and submitting the exact same request multiple times would create duplicate resources. Note:- Omitting this header increases the risk of duplicate transactions, which for payments could cost the client issues like double-billing.
(Required) used to indicate the media type of the resource.

description.content: This API supports to cancel the transactions using transaction ID for pending transactions. In case of ACH, cancellation can be done once the payments is disbursed to recipient(i.e - reversal of an original transaction).

variable.description: (Required) when called by merchant value can be 1. Transaction Id generated at the time of payment initialization 2. Merchant provided reference Number. when called by recipient, value can be 1. payment Id Id generated at the time of payment initialization

description.content: This API collects the Payment information make a payment.

variable.description: (Required) Id generated at the time of payment request initialization. This is paymentId.

header.description: (Required) An API key is a string value passed by a client app to the API proxies. The key uniquely identifies the client app.
(Required) Epoch timestamp in the request initiating system

(Required) Contains a unique ID generated by the client that can be used for enforcing idempotency on POST actions. POSTs are inherently non-idempotent and submitting the exact same request multiple times would create duplicate resources. Note:- Omitting this header increases the risk of duplicate transactions, which for payments could cost the client issues like double-billing.
Token provided by DDP along with public key /tokens API. This is required for encrypted PCI data vaulting. This is to identify public key associated with access token to decrypt the PCI data.

description.content: This API returns currency conversion details which will be made available to Merchant as value added service.

response.name: Currency Conversion response - Success
Currency Conversion response - Bad request
Currency Conversion response - Internal server error.

description.content: This API Specification document list required APIs for initializing & disbursed Payments or  canceling payments. Provided list of Payment methods are enabled for merchant.
